On the death of Melchiades Bishop of Rome in 314, Sylvester was elected to succeed him. Very soon afterwards, in the autumn of the same year, the council of Arles was assembled to decide the dispute between Caecilian bishop of Carthage‚ and the Numidian bishops who followed Donatus of Casa- nigra. Sylvester was represented in the synod by four legates, two priests, and two deacons. The
